result.execSummary:
The defendant Derwin Durand Purifoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to case 20CM2051, with credit for 5 days served.

Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 8/29/2022.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022.

miscConds.notes:
- Court set restitution at zero.
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.

- No contact with firearms.
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
- No contact with SLH which rises to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment with victim".

- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derwin Durand Purifoy in court.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Derwin Durand Purifoy.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 2 and 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to case 20CM2051, with credit for 5 days served. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- As to Count 1: Serve 15 days condition time in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- No contact with SLH which rises to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment with victim".
- No contact with firearms.
- Court set restitution at zero.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 8/29/2022.

Probation review hearing scheduled in Branch 29.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derwin Durand Purifoy in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel requests an in person hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Derwin Durand Purifoy in court.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Allison Ritter, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Court vacates the pre-trial conference on 6/1/22 at 1:30 pm. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derwin Durand Purifoy in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Derwin Durand Purifoy in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Derwin Durand Purifoy appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  
This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
